channel.title: [dev]Minor RSCD_V25 fix
channel.description:
This is a minor fix for rscd_v25 source that i figured out since it was annoying me that my forums were saying that everyone that had gone online at anytime was online even if they were logged off
First: Go to your unregisterPlayer method (can't remember the exact file right now)
Second: at the top of it put [code]try{[/code]
Third: Right above the [code]players.remove(user);[/code] part put [code]Server.db.updateQuery("UPDATE `rscd_players` SET loggedin='" + 0 + "' WHERE user=" + user);[/code]
Fourth: At the very end put [code] catch(Exception e) { Server.error(e); }[/code]
All done this fixes the showing of logged on players on forums even while they aren't, and also may fix some confusion in codes

item.title: [dev]Minor RSCD_V25 fix
item.dc:creator: @Peter Peeter
item.description:
@Peter wrote:

Actually RSCD used cron to update the lists periodically. The files used for the updates are in the www/crontab folder.

Read full topic

item.title: [dev]Minor RSCD_V25 fix
item.dc:creator: @Spyke8x Spyke8x
item.description:
@Spyke8x wrote:

This is a minor fix for rscd_v25 source that i figured out since it was annoying me that my forums were saying that everyone that had gone online at anytime was online even if they were logged off

First:
Go to your unregisterPlayer method (can’t remember the exact file right now)

Second:
at the top of it put try{

Third:
Right above the players.remove(user); part put Server.db.updateQuery("UPDATE `rscd_players` SET loggedin='" + 0 + "' WHERE user=" + user);

Fourth:
At the very end put catch(Exception e) { Server.error(e); }

All done this fixes the showing of logged on players on forums even while they aren’t, and also may fix some confusion in codes
